If it's not replacing anything then you put it in the wrong folder. Put the crack in C:Program Files (x86)EA GAMESThe Sims 2 Mansion and Garden StuffTSBin

So that's in the TSBin folder, which is in the Mansion and Garden Stuff folder, which is in the EA GAMES folder which is in your program files folder.

For DirectX, download this:

http://www.microsoft.com/downloads/details.aspx?familyid=3B170B25-ABAB-4BC3-AE91-50CEB6D8FA8D&displaylang=en

hiya, i'm having problemswith mine...i'm a bit shit at all this so forgive me lol. When i go to open a file a window comes up and say 'Windows cannot open this file' then gives me the option to choose from a list of programs or go online :s heelp !!

Lol I'm assuming you're trying to open a .iso, .mds, or .mdf file? You need to mount those to a "virtual drive" with daemon tools. A virtual drive is like an imaginary extra drive on your computer. So how do you put CDs in it if it's "imaginary"? That's what ISO, MDS, and MDF files are for. Those three files are virtual versions of a CD. You mount them (mounting is like inserting a disk, but virtually) with the program Daemon Tools (you can find that program on this site) and then open the DVD drive they are mounted to to find the setup file. Btw, you can make these virtual drives with Daemon Tools. lol

With MDS and MDF files, they work together; so they both have to be mounted at the same time to work. When you mount one with daemon tools, it'll use the other automatically. And for them to work together, they have to have the same exact file name (with the extension name differing being an exception, of course).

Good luck

as far as some of the other comments...
you have to use the crack file you placed in mansion and garden stuff, hence why the uploader worded the instructions they way they did! even if this wasnt cracked thats the way the sims games work, it uses the last expansion to launch the game!
and the direct x thing... just cause you have direct x 11 does not mean you have direct x 9!!! those are different versions of direct x! one does not get updated to the other like a software update! hence why vista and win 7 do not come with direct x 9, cause microsoft only includes the most recent version and not the previous versions! if you do not remember running the direct x update then you most likely do not have direct x 9!!
